page.title: 02Eastchurch Village
page.content: The{village}of Eastchurch was mentioned in the Domesday Book as Eastcryne. It is a small, closely knit community with a relatively unchanging {population}where families have lived for many years. The church of All Saints is a feature of the centre of the village retaining evidence of the past. During the day few people are seen in the village as most travel to work elsewhere. Although there is a village school for younger children all those over the age of nine travel by bus to schools in Sheerness seven miles away. Basic amenities can be found there as there are one or two shops, public houses, a garage, a restaurant and a hairdressers. The village hall is frequently used for{clubs}and{entertainment.
